question: Describe the difference between the internet and the world wide web.
answer:
• Internet is the hardware/infrastructure/network of connected devices
• World wide web is a collection of websites/web pages (on the internet)

question:
Complete the table with the missing terms and descriptions:

Term	Description
......	the collective name for all the web pages available
(a) State what is meant by a URL.
answer:
• Text-based address for a website
• (Can contain) protocol/domain name/web page name

question:
(b) Identify two different parts of a URL.
1. ______
2. ______
answer:
Any two from:
• Protocol
• Domain name
• Filename/web page/file name

question:
The uniform resource locator (URL) for a website includes the protocol hypertext transfer protocol secure (HTTPS).
Explain how HTTPS makes the transmission of data secure.
answer:
• Uses encryption
• Data is unreadable if intercepted
• Uses Secure Socket Layer (SSL) protocol
• SSL uses public/private key encryption
• SSL provides authentication to check the website is genuine

question:
The employee wants to be able to quickly access websites that he regularly uses.
Identify the function of a web browser that could be used for this purpose.
Draw and annotate a diagram to show how the web page is located and retrieved to be displayed on the student’s tablet computer.
answer:
The diagram should demonstrate (1 mark each):
• The browser sending a request using the URL
• The DNS converting the domain name to an IP address
• The browser contacting the web server using the IP address
• The web server sending the HTML/web page back to the browser
• The browser rendering the HTML to display the page

question:
Complete the statements about cookies.
Use only terms from the list.
Not all terms need to be used. Some terms may be used more than once.

binary, close, denary, expire, hexadecimal, image, malware, operating system, permanent, persistent, session, sound, temporary, web browser

Cookies are small text files that are stored by a ______.
______ cookies are ______ text files that are deleted when the ______ is closed.
______ cookies are ______ text files that are stored on a user’s secondary storage device until they are manually deleted or they ______.
answer:
• web browser
• session
• temporary
• web browser
• persistent
• permanent
• expire
